verses.roman:
vṛtau gopaiḥ katipayair
baladeva-janārdanau
raṅgaṁ viviśatū rājan
gaja-danta-varāyudhau

synonyms: vṛtau—surrounded; gopaiḥ—by cowherd boys; katipayaiḥ—several; baladeva-janārdanau—Balarāma and Kṛṣṇa; raṅgam—the arena; viviśatuḥ—entered; rājan—O King (Parīkṣit); gaja-danta—the elephant's tusks; vara—chosen; āyudhau—whose weapons.
translation: My dear King, Lord Baladeva and Lord Janārdana, each carrying one of the elephant's tusks as His chosen weapon, entered the arena with several cowherd boys.
